meanings.definition: A flexible measuring tape used for taking measurements.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used a tapeline to measure the length of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a tapeline in my sewing kit for accurate measurements.
meanings.sent3: The tapeline and the ruler had a race to see who could measure faster!
meanings.sent4: Her precision was like a tapeline, always accurate and never off by a millimeter.
meanings.sent5: The tapeline curled up neatly after each use, ready for the next measurement.

meanings.definition: To measure or mark with a tapeline.
meanings.sent1: She tapelines the fabric before cutting to ensure the right size.
meanings.sent2: We tapeline the room dimensions before buying new furniture.
meanings.sent3: He tapelines the distance between his desk and the coffee machine for fun.
meanings.sent4: The surveyor tapelines the land, mapping out the property boundaries.
meanings.sent5: Tapelining the walls with precision, she marked each spot for the shelves.
